attributes.title: Secrets Of Real Heaven Beyond Death by Swami Nithyananda
attributes.description:
In today’s Nithya Satsang (3rd July, 2015), live from Varanasi, Paramahamsa Nithyananda expands on the Shanti Mantra of Kathopanishad, which reveals the secrets of death and life. Kathopanishad should be the day-to-day book that gives the understanding and context of Death, and how to live Life with unending excitement. Introducing the 3 characters of Kathopanishad, He reveals that – Naciketa is the first hero of Vedas who is embodiment of Satva, pure seeking. Naciketa’s father Vajashravas, is the king who is embodiment of Rajas, the insecurity and confusion born of fear of losing pleasures. Yama Dharma is the Rishi of Upanshad, Death himself - fear and compassion. Vajashravas plans to retain his wealth & pleasures by planning for heaven by giving poor charity. The real heaven is completion, here and now. The solution for Rajas, insecurity and confusion is to live in 'self-imposed poverty' for at least a year, which makes us drop the ""Mine"" and reinvent our ""I"" from the space of completion. 

The topic for today’s Vakayartha Sadas, exploring the spiritual truth by Paramahamsa Nithyananda is – “Self-imposed poverty, the way to reinvent yourself.”
